name: lib/cache.js
lib/entries/epv.js
EPV
description: Entry composing the partial view of a peer.

params.name: peerId
params.description: The identifier of the neighbor.

params.name: descriptor
params.description: The descriptor of this neighbor.

name: update
description: Update the descriptor of the entry

params.name: descriptor
params.description: The new descriptor assigned to this neigbhor.

name: increment
description: Increment the ages

name: add
description: Add a new 'instance' of this neigbhor, i.e., add a new age entry.

name: removeOldest
description: Remove the oldest entry of this neighbor.

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} True if the entry has no age anymore, false otherwise.

return.description: True if the entry has no age anymore, false otherwise.

name: removeYoungest
description: Remove the youngest entry of this neigbhor.

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} True if the entry has no age anymore, false otherwise.

return.description: True if the entry has no age anymore, false otherwise.

name: oldest
description: Get the oldest age of this neighbor.

name: count
description: Get the number of occurrences of this neighbor.

name: lib/exceptions/exinterface.js
ExInterface
description:
Exception thrown when the interface to create a t-man has not been
fullfilled.

params.name: source
params.description: The function name that threw this exception.

name: lib/exceptions/exjoin.js
ExJoin
description: Exception threw when the joining phase of Spray does not work as intended.

params.name: source
params.description: The name of the function that threw the exception.

params.name: reason
params.description: The reason the joining failed.

name: lib/exceptions/exmessage.js
ExMessage
description: Spray encountered a problem with a message.

params.name: source
params.description: The name of the function that threw.

params.name: message
params.description: The incriminated message.

params.name: reason
params.description: The reason of the throw.

name: lib/exceptions/expeernotfound.js
ExPeerNotFound
description:
Exception that rises when the peer looked for does not exist in the partial
view.

params.name: source
params.description: The function that throw the error.

params.name: peerId
params.description:
The identifier of the peer if
defined.

name: lib/messages/mgivedescriptor.js
MGiveDescriptor
description: Message that gives your descriptor to another peer.

params.name: inview
params.description: The identifier of the inview of the sender.

params.name: descriptor
params.description: The descriptor of the sender.

name: lib/messages/mjoin.js
MJoin
description: Message sent by a newcommer to its contact when it joins the network.

params.name: inview
params.description: The identifier of the inview of the newcomer.

params.name: descriptor
params.description: The descriptor of the newcomer.

name: lib/messages/mrequestdescriptor.js
MRequestDescriptor
description: Message sent by a peer asking for the receiver to send its descriptor.

name: lib/messages/mrequire.js
MRequire
description:
Message sent by a peer to another. The latter tries to connect the former to
peers contained in this message.

params.name: peers
params.description:
The identifiers of peers that the sender
requests.

name: lib/messages/msuggest.js
MSuggest
description: Message sent by a peer to another one in order to suggest new connection.

params.name: inview
params.description: The identifier of the inview of the sender.

params.name: descriptor
params.description: The descriptor of the sender.

params.name: sample
params.description:
The sample containing the identifier of peers
and their descriptor.

name: lib/messages/msuggestback.js
MSuggestBack
description:
Message sent by a peer to another one in order to suggest new
connection. This message is an answer to a MSuggest.

params.name: sample
params.description:
The sample containing the identifier of peers
and their descriptor.

name: lib/partialview.js
PartialView
description:
Structure containing the neighborhood of a peer. Each neigbhor entry
comprises a list of ages and a descriptor.  Map of {idPeer => {ages:[age_1,
age_2.. age_k], descriptor: {x: exampleX} }} where age_1 <= age_2 <= .. <=
age_k.

name: oldest
description: Get the oldest peer in the partial view.

unknown.tagValue: {string} The oldest peer in the structure.

return.description: The oldest peer in the structure.

name: increment
description: Increment the age of the whole partial view

name: addNeighbor
description: Add the peer to the partial view with an age of 0.

params.name: peerId
params.description:
The identifier of the peer added to the partial
view.

params.name: descriptor
params.description: The descriptor of the peer.

name: updateNeighbor
description: Update the peer's descriptor.

params.name: peerId
params.description: The identifier of the peer to update.

params.name: descriptor
params.description: The new descriptor of peerId.

name: removeOldest
description: Remove the newest entry of the peer from the partial view.

params.name: peerId
params.description:
The identifier of the peer to remove from the
partial view.

name: removeAllNeighbor
description: Remove all entries of the peer from the partial view.

unknown.tagValue: {number} The number of occurrences of peerId removed.

params.name: peerId
params.description:
The identifier of the peer to remove from the
partial view.

return.description: The number of occurrences of peerId removed.

name: leastFrequent
description:
Get the least frequent peer. If multiple peers have the same number of
occurrences, it chooses one among them at random.

unknown.tagValue: {string} The identifier of a least frequent peer.

return.description: The identifier of a least frequent peer.

name: getDescriptor
description: Get the descriptor of the peer in argument.

params.name: peerId
params.description: The identifier of the peer.

name: lib/tman.js
TMan
description:
Peer-sampling protocol running on top of WebRTC that builds network
topologies using ranking functions.

params.name: options
params.description:
Options given to TMan to build the desired
topology.

params.name: options.pid
params.description:
The identifier of this
protocol.

params.name: options.delta
params.description:
Every delta millisecond, exchange
neighbors of the partial view.

params.name: options.timeout
params.description:
WebRTC connections are
expensive to establish, may fail, etc. Instead of immediately removing
them, the protocol keep them warm during options.timeout
milliseconds. Consequently, messages transiting through them can still be
transmitted, and if the protocol requires such an arc, it can be
reestablished at no cost.

params.name: options.descriptorTimeout
params.description:
Peers regularly ask
for descriptor and await an answer. If this answer does not come up in
time, it throws an exception.

params.name: parent
params.description:
This module can depend of another peer-sampling
protocol. If set, it will share the neighbors populating its inview and
outview. Thus, the above options will be of no use. See neigbhorhood-wrtc
module for more informations on the sharing process.

name: join
description: Joining a network.

unknown.tagValue:
{Promise} A promise that is resolved when the peer joins the
network; rejected after a timeout, or already connected state.

params.name: sender
params.description:
Function that will be called each time an offer
arrives to this peer. It is the responsability of the caller to send
these offer (using sender) to the contact inside the network.

return.description:
A promise that is resolved when the peer joins the
network; rejected after a timeout, or already connected state.

params.name: peerId
params.description: The identifier of the newcomer.

params.name: message
params.description: The message sent by the newcomer.

params.name: peerId
params.description:
The identifier of the peer with which we
failed to create a connection. Null if it was yet to be known.

params.name: peerId
params.description:
The identifier of the peer that seems
left/crashed.

params.name: flatten
params.description: Array of identifiers.

return.description: The size of the sample to create.

params.name: neighbor
params.description:
Object containing .peer for identifier of the
peer to exchange with and .descriptor for the peer's descriptor.

params.name: peerId
params.description: The identifier of the initiating peer.

params.name: message
params.description: The message containing the suggestions.

params.name: peerId
params.description: The identifier of the peer that sent the message.

params.name: message
params.description: The message received.

params.name: peerId
params.description:
The identifier of the peer that requests
connections.

params.name: message
params.description: The request message.

params.name: peerId
params.description: The identifier of the peer that sent the message.

params.name: message
params.description: The message received.

unknown.tagValue:
{Promise} Resolved when the descriptor has been added to our
cache; Rejected after a timeout or an error when sending the message.

params.name: peerId
params.description: The identifier of the peer.

return.description:
Resolved when the descriptor has been added to our
cache; Rejected after a timeout or an error when sending the message.

params.name: peerId
params.description: The identifier of the requester.

params.name: message
params.description: The message received.

params.name: peerId
params.description: The identifier of the new neighbor.

params.name: peerId
params.description: The identifier of the peer to check.

params.name: peerId
params.description: The identifier of the removed arc.

name: getPeers
description:
Get k neighbors from the partial view. If k is not reached, it tries to
fill the gap with neighbors from the inview.  It is worth noting that
each peer controls its outview but not its inview. The more the neigbhors
from the outview the better.

params.name: k
params.description:
The number of neighbors requested. If k is not defined,
it returns every known identifiers of the partial view.

content:
# tman-wrtc [![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/RAN3D/tman-wrtc.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/RAN3D/tman-wrtc) Keywords: T-Man, configurable network topology, WebRTC This project aims to provide an implementation of the T-Man [1] using WebRTC. T-Man is a protocol that builds an overlay network based on descriptors. Created by the developer, and exploiting the descriptors, a fitness function allows choosing the right neighborhood. For instance, implementing the distributed hash table Chord on top of T-Man is possible [2]. # Principle

As the screenshot shows, each peer maintains a random peer-sampling protocol (on the left) which allows clustering protocols to avoid local minima, and a clustering protocol (on the right) that collects, sorts, and keeps descriptors along with sockets. On this example, descriptors are numbers and each peer keeps 4 neighbors: its closest in terms of euclidean distance. After a few shufflings, this overlay network remains stable, for peers do not leave nor join the network, and descriptors are not updated. Peers iterate over closer-and-closer neighbors until they reach their optimal position. On the opposite, the random peer-sampling protocol stays dynamic over time. ## Installation ```$ npm install tman-wrtc``` ## References [1] M. Jelasity, A. Montresor, and O. Babaoglu. [T-man: Gossip-based fast overlay topology construction](http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download?doi=10.1.1.217.1149&rep=rep1&type=pdf) Comput. Netw., vol. 53, no. 13, pp. 2321-2339, 2009. [2] A. Montresor, M. Jelasity, O. Babaoglu, [Chord on Demand](http://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/1551024/) Fifth IEEE International Conference on Peer-to-Peer Computing (P2P'05), pp. 87-94, 2005.
name: ./README.md

content:
{
    "name": "tman-wrtc",
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "author": "Chat-Wane <grumpy.chat.wane@gmail.com>",
    "description": "Peer-sampling protocol running on top of WebRTC that builds network topologies using ranking functions",
    "main": "./lib/tman.js",
    "repository": {
        "type": "git",
        "url": "https://github.com/ran3d/tman-wrtc"
    },
    "keywords": [
        "Peer-sampling protocol",
        "Topology",
        "browser-to-browser communication",
        "WebRTC"
    ],
    "dependencies": {
        "debug": "^3.1.0",
        "lodash": "^4.17.5",
        "lodash.isempty": "^4.4.0",
        "n2n-overlay-wrtc": "^2.0.x",
        "unicast-definition": "^2.0.1"
    },
    "bundledDependencies": [
        "lodash",
        "lodash.isempty",
        "debug",
        "n2n-overlay-wrtc",
        "unicast-definition"
    ],
    "devDependencies": {
        "browserify": "^16.1.1",
        "esdoc": "^1.0.4",
        "esdoc-ecmascript-proposal-plugin": "^1.0.0",
        "esdoc-node": "^1.0.3",
        "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
        "p2p-graph": "^1.2.2",
        "snazzy": "^7.1.1",
        "spray-wrtc": "^2.0.4",
        "standard": "^11.0.1"
    },
    "scripts": {
        "lint": "standard --verbose | snazzy",
        "fix": "standard --fix --verbose ./lib/**.js",
        "debug": "browserify -r ./lib/tman.js:tman-wrtc --debug > build/tman-wrtc.bundle.debug.js",
        "build": "browserify -r ./lib/tman.js:tman-wrtc > build/tman-wrtc.bundle.js",
        "esdoc": "esdoc && npm run esdoc:example",
        "esdoc:example": "cp -R ./build ./examples ./img ./docs",
        "test": "npm run all",
        "all": "npm run debug && npm run build && npm run esdoc"
    },
    "license": "MIT",
    "standard": {
        "ignore": [
            "build/**",
            "examples/**",
            "img/**"
        ]
    }
}
name: package.json
